Build 200405131200

I found the following in my .log file. I believe this happened when I closed a bunch of editors 
(including PDE editors) which hadn't been reinstantiated yet.

Jared, what does it mean 'hadn't been reinstantiated yet'? The code in 
question is a line where editor toolkit is disposed, and NPE can only happen 
when toolkit instance is null. Since the toolkit is created very early in the 
creation of an editor, this is a very strange event (one of those 'should not 
happen' branches in code :-).

IEditorParts aren't instantiated until an editor is activated. Before that, all you have is an 
IEditorReference. That's the state I'm referring to when I say that I had editors which hadn't been 
"reinstantiated yet".

Aha... So you claim that an editor can be closed before ever being 
instantiated?

Fixed by checking if toolkit is not null before disposing it. I was not avare 
of the fact that editor can be instantiated but not created, then disposed.
